intro: Tulipa hexagonata, commonly known as the hexagonate tulip, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from deep red to orange and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters, with narrow, strap-like leaves. Its bulbs are adapted to survive in cold climates, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. The flowers have six prominent lobes, giving the plant its scientific name.
